page.title: 09A DAY AT S.C. POST OFFICE
page.content: The building is over 200 years old, although it has only become a Post Office recently. It was originally 5 cottages for poor folk, owned by the CUTTS charity. The inmates used to break stones in the back yard. Later it became the village reading room. It has been a shop for many years now, although the Post Office was only added in 1975. On Friday 28th June, I sat in the Post Office counting customers. I counted from 9am until noon. 227 people came into the shop. The majority were from Cerney: some had walked, others had driven in their cars. Most used the shop at least twice a week, although younger people did most of their shopping in Cirencester. Older customers complained at the prices in Cerney and their lack of transport.
